Let's include these in the ontology.```turtle@prefix ex: <http://example.com#> .@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .ex:City rdf:type rdf:Class .ex:name rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain ex:City ;    rdfs:range rdfs:Literal .ex:country rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain ex:City ;    rdfs:range ex:Country .ex:population rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain ex:City ;    rdfs:range rdfs:Literal .```With this, we can represent cities and have the properties name, country, and population.
